meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of cinchona.
meanings.sent1: The cinchonic flavor of the tonic water reminded me of the bitter taste of medicine.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a cinchonic pattern that resembled the bark of a tree.
meanings.sent3: The cinchonic scent of the perfume made me feel like I was walking through a forest.
meanings.sent4: The cinchonic atmosphere of the room transported me to a tropical jungle.
meanings.sent5: The cinchonic color of the painting evoked memories of the quinine plantations.

meanings.definition: A substance derived from cinchona bark, used in the treatment of malaria.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a cinchonic medication to treat the patient's malaria.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist recommended a cinchonic extract to alleviate the symptoms of the disease.
meanings.sent3: The cinchonic remedy proved to be a lifesaver for those suffering from malaria.
meanings.sent4: The researchers discovered a new cinchonic compound that showed promising results in malaria treatment.
meanings.sent5: The cinchonic drug was hailed as a breakthrough in the fight against the deadly disease.
